verses.text: Rebuke not an elder, but entreat him as a father; and the younger men as brethren;

similars.text: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.

And the young men that were grown up with him spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou speak unto this people that spake unto thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter unto us; thus shalt thou say unto them, My little finger shall be thicker than my father's loins.
Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.
For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, and we should come together in judgment.

And the young men that were brought up with him spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou answer the people that spake unto thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it somewhat lighter for us; thus shalt thou say unto them, My little finger shall be thicker than my father's loins.
We be twelve brethren, sons of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.
And be not ye like your fathers, and like your brethren, which trespassed against the Lord God of their fathers, who therefore gave them up to desolation, as ye see.
Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour, and not suffer sin upon him.
Gather yourselves together, and hear, ye sons of Jacob; and hearken unto Israel your father.
Take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man:

verses.text: The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.

similars.text: And thine elder sister is Samaria, she and her daughters that dwell at thy left hand: and thy younger sister, that dwelleth at thy right hand, is Sodom and her daughters.
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister: for she is thy mother's near kinswoman.
Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

Thou art thy mother's daughter, that lotheth her husband and her children; and thou art the sister of thy sisters, which lothed their husbands and their children: your mother was an Hittite, and your father an Amorite.

Then thou shalt remember thy ways, and be ashamed, when thou shalt receive thy sisters, thine elder and thy younger: and I will give them unto thee for daughters, but not by thy covenant.
The nakedness of thy father's wife's daughter, begotten of thy father, she is thy sister, thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.

And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.

Behold their women did toil and spin, and did make all manner of cloth, of fine-twined linen and cloth of every kind, to clothe their nakedness. And thus the sixty and fourth year did pass away in peace.

verses.text: Honour widows that are widows indeed.

similars.text: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.

Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.

Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

verses.text: But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.

similars.text: Wherefore, I, the Lord, give unto you this commandment, that ye obtain places for your families, inasmuch as your brethren are willing to open their hearts.

Leave thy fatherless children, I will preserve them alive; and let thy widows trust in me.

Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.
Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge the fatherless, plead for the widow.
Be strong and of a good courage: for unto this people shalt thou divide for an inheritance the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give them.

Therefore I give unto you a commandment, to teach these things freely unto your children, saying:

verses.text: Now she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusteth in God, and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day.

similars.text: And she arose, and went away, and laid by her veil from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.

And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law.

Now therefore restore the man his wife; for he is a prophet, and he shall pray for thee, and thou shalt live: and if thou restore her not, know thou that thou shalt surely die, thou, and all that are thine.
For the Lord hath called thee as a woman forsaken and grieved in spirit, and a wife of youth, when thou wast refused, saith thy God.

verses.text: But she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.

similars.text: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.
Let her not be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed when he cometh out of his mother's womb.

Live joyfully with the wife whom thou lovest all the days of the life of thy vanity, which he hath given thee under the sun, all the days of thy vanity: for that is thy portion in this life, and in thy labour which thou takest under the sun.
What hath my beloved to do in mine house, seeing she hath wrought lewdness with many, and the holy flesh is passed from thee? when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.
Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

This is the rejoicing city that dwelt carelessly, that said in her heart, I am, and there is none beside me: how is she become a desolation, a place for beasts to lie down in! every one that passeth by her shall hiss, and wag his hand.
Her filthiness is in her skirts; she remembereth not her last end; therefore she came down wonderfully: she had no comforter. O Lord, behold my affliction: for the enemy hath magnified himself.

But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.

verses.text: And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.

similars.text: Therefore, they are left without excuse, and their sins are upon their own heads.

verses.text: But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.

similars.text: He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.

He that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.
And his servants conspired against him, and slew him in his own house.
Woe unto him that buildeth his house by unrighteousness, and his chambers by wrong; that useth his neighbour's service without wages, and giveth him not for his work;

Because he hath oppressed and hath forsaken the poor; because he hath violently taken away an house which he builded not;

verses.text: Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, having been the wife of one man,

similars.text: A widow, or a divorced woman, or profane, or an harlot, these shall he not take: but he shall take a virgin of his own people to wife.
Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

Moreover thou shalt not lie carnally with thy neighbour's wife, to defile thyself with her.
So he that goeth in to his neighbour's wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.
When a man hath taken a new wife, he shall not go out to war, neither shall he be charged with any business: but he shall be free at home one year, and shall cheer up his wife which he hath taken.
If he take him another wife; her food, her raiment, and her duty of marriage, shall he not diminish.
They shall not take a wife that is a whore, or profane; neither shall they take a woman put away from her husband: for he is holy unto his God.
Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.

Her former husband, which sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife, after that she is defiled; for that is abomination before the Lord: and thou shalt not cause the land to sin, which the Lord thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.

verses.text: Well reported of for good works; if she have brought up children, if she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the saints' feet, if she have relieved the afflicted, if she have diligently followed every good work.

similars.text: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

For I remember the word of God which saith by their works ye shall know them; for if their works be good, then they are good also.

Neither shall they take for their wives a widow, nor her that is put away: but they shall take maidens of the seed of the house of Israel, or a widow that had a priest before.

verses.text: Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

similars.text: Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.

And thus we can plainly discern, that after a people have been once enlightened by the Spirit of God, and have had great knowledge of things pertaining to righteousness, and then have fallen away into sin and transgression, they become more hardened, and thus their state becomes worse than though they had never known these things.
Thy first father hath sinned, and thy teachers have transgressed against me.
And now, ye see by this that our first parents were cut off both temporally and spiritually from the presence of the Lord; and thus we see they became subjects to follow after their own will.
And it came to pass that I beheld, after they had dwindled in unbelief they became a dark, and loathsome, and a filthy people, full of idleness and all manner of abominations.
Yea, O Lord, and thou seest that they have repented, because of the famine and the pestilence and destruction which has come unto them.

And if they be evil they are consigned to an awful view of their own guilt and abominations, which doth cause them to shrink from the presence of the Lord into a state of misery and endless torment, from whence they can no more return; therefore they have drunk damnation to their own souls.
Woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me.
The women of my people have ye cast out from their pleasant houses; from their children have ye taken away my glory for ever.

verses.text: And withal they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.

Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?

verses.text: I will therefore that the younger women marry, bear children, guide the house, give none occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.

verses.text: For some are already turned aside after Satan.

verses.text: If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be charged; that it may relieve them that are widows indeed.

verses.text: Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

similars.text: Verily, I say unto you, saith the Lord of Hosts, there must needs be presiding elders to preside over those who are of the office of an elder;
And this cannot be brought to pass until mine elders are endowed with power from on high.

Both riches and honour come of thee, and thou reignest over all; and in thine hand is power and might; and in thine hand it is to make great, and to give strength unto all.

Behold, this commandment is given unto all the elders whom I have chosen.

And there shall rise up one mighty among them, who shall do much good, both in word and in deed, being an instrument in the hands of God, with exceeding faith, to work mighty wonders, and do that thing which is great in the sight of God, unto the bringing to pass much restoration unto the house of Israel, and unto the seed of thy brethren.

verses.text: For the scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn. And, The labourer is worthy of his reward.

similars.text: Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out the corn.
Thou shalt not be idle; for he that is idle shall not eat the bread nor wear the garments of the laborer.
Thou shalt not plow with an ox and an ass together.
And the swine, because it divideth the hoof, yet cheweth not the cud, it is unclean unto you: ye shall not eat of their flesh, nor touch their dead carcase.
When thou comest into the standing corn of thy neighbour, then thou mayest pluck the ears with thine hand; but thou shalt not move a sickle unto thy neighbour's standing corn.
Thou shalt not sacrifice unto the Lord thy God any bullock, or sheep, wherein is blemish, or any evilfavouredness: for that is an abomination unto the Lord thy God.

Thine ox shall be slain before thine eyes, and thou shalt not eat thereof: thine ass shall be violently taken away from before thy face, and shall not be restored to thee: thy sheep shall be given unto thine enemies, and thou shalt have none to rescue them.
Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.

Thou mayest not eat within thy gates the tithe of thy corn, or of thy wine, or of thy oil, or the firstlings of thy herds or of thy flock, nor any of thy vows which thou vowest, nor thy freewill offerings, or heave offering of thine hand:
Nevertheless these shall ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the hoof: as the camel, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean unto you.

verses.text: Against an elder receive not an accusation, but before two or three witnesses.

similars.text: At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall he that is worthy of death be put to death; but at the mouth of one witness he shall not be put to death.

And the testimony of three witnesses will I send forth of my word.
Neither shalt thou bear false witness against thy neighbour.

Thou shalt not raise a false report: put not thine hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.

verses.text: Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.

similars.text: Though a sinner do evil an hundred times, and his days be prolonged, yet surely I know that it shall be well with them that fear God, which fear before him:

It may be they will present their supplication before the Lord, and will return every one from his evil way: for great is the anger and the fury that the Lord hath pronounced against this people.

verses.text: I charge thee before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.

similars.text: For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.

And set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation; and give him a charge in their sight.
I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.
I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
Thou shalt have no other God before me.
And they shall keep his charge, and the charge of the whole congregation before the tabernacle of the congregation, to do the service of the tabernacle.

And wo unto all those who come not unto this priesthood which ye have received, which I now confirm upon you who are present this day, by mine own voice out of the heavens; and even I have given the heavenly hosts and mine angels charge concerning you.

And now my beloved brethren, I have said these things unto you that I might awaken you to a sense of your duty to God, that ye may walk blameless before him, that ye may walk after the holy order of God, after which ye have been received.

verses.text: Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other men's sins: keep thyself pure.

similars.text: And in nothing doth man offend God, or against none is his wrath kindled, save those who confess not his hand in all things, and obey not his commandments.
Thy hands were not bound, nor thy feet put into fetters: as a man falleth before wicked men, so fellest thou. And all the people wept again over him.
Seek not to be cumbered. Forsake all unrighteousness. Commit not adultery--a temptation with which thou hast been troubled.
Should thy lies make men hold their peace? and when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?
But if he thrust him suddenly without enmity, or have cast upon him any thing without laying of wait,
Thou shalt not pervert the judgment of the stranger, nor of the fatherless; nor take a widow's raiment to pledge:
I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?
Ask him to shake hands with you, but he will not move, because it is contrary to the order of heaven for a just man to deceive; but he will still deliver his message.
And he said, Lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do thou any thing unto him: for now I know that thou fearest God, seeing thou hast not withheld thy son, thine only son from me.
Wherefore, let every man beware lest he do that which is not in truth and righteousness before me.

verses.text: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach's sake and thine often infirmities.

similars.text: And, again, strong drinks are not for the belly, but for the washing of your bodies.
Now therefore beware, I pray thee, and drink not wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing:
Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
He shall separate himself from wine and strong drink, and shall drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of strong drink, neither shall he drink any liquor of grapes, nor eat moist grapes, or dried.
Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:
Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
Awake, ye drunkards, and weep; and howl, all ye drinkers of wine, because of the new wine; for it is cut off from your mouth.
Stay yourselves, and wonder; cry ye out, and cry: they are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.
Therefore hear now this, thou afflicted, and drunken, and not with wine:
Therefore hear now this, thou afflicted, and drunken, but not with wine:

verses.text: Some men's sins are open beforehand, going before to judgment; and some men they follow after.

similars.text: If there be a controversy between men, and they come unto judgment, that the judges may judge them; then they shall justify the righteous, and condemn the wicked.
Wherefore, let every man beware lest he do that which is not in truth and righteousness before me.
We believe that men will be punished for their own sins, and not for Adam's transgression.
By this ye may know if a man repenteth of his sins--behold, he will confess them and forsake them.
Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
Wherefore the sin of the young men was very great before the Lord: for men abhorred the offering of the Lord.

Therefore I say unto you, Go; and whosoever transgresseth against me, him shall ye judge according to the sins which he has committed; and if he confess his sins before thee and me, and repenteth in the sincerity of his heart, him shall ye forgive, and I will forgive him also.
Wherefore, honest men and wise men should be sought for diligently, and good men and wise men ye should observe to uphold; otherwise whatsoever is less than these cometh of evil.
Wherefore, I will that all men shall repent, for all are under sin, except those which I have reserved unto myself, holy men that ye know not of.

Yea, and I know that good and evil have come before all men; he that knoweth not good from evil is blameless; but he that knoweth good and evil, to him it is given according to his desires, whether he desireth good or evil, life or death, joy or remorse of conscience.

verses.text: Likewise also the good works of some are manifest beforehand; and they that are otherwise cannot be hid.

similars.text: Wherefore, be not weary in well-doing, for ye are laying the foundation of a great work. And out of small things proceedeth that which is great.
And by their desires and their works you shall know them.
Some things they may have guessed right, among so many; but behold, we know that all these great and marvelous works cannot come to pass, of which has been spoken.
Yea even among the Gentiles shall there be a great and marvelous work wrought by them, before that judgment day.

But a seer can know of things which are past, and also of things which are to come, and by them shall all things be revealed, or, rather, shall secret things be made manifest, and hidden things shall come to light, and things which are not known shall be made known by them, and also things shall be made known by them which otherwise could not be known.

For in that day, for my sake shall the Father work a work, which shall be a great and a marvelous work among them; and there shall be among them those who will not believe it, although a man shall declare it unto them.

And the members shall manifest before the church, and also before the elders, by a godly walk and conversation, that they are worthy of it, that there may be works and faith agreeable to the holy scriptures--walking in holiness before the Lord.
For I remember the word of God which saith by their works ye shall know them; for if their works be good, then they are good also.
Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.
Now, there were many before him, and also there were many afterwards, but none were greater; therefore, of him they have more particularly made mention.
